definition[0]: if a piece of information, news etc comes through, it arrives somewhere
example[0]: We’re still waiting for our exam results to come through.
example[1]: There is news just coming through of an explosion in a chemical factory.
definition[1]: to be made official, especially by having the correct documents officially approved
example[2]: I’m still waiting for my divorce to come through.
definition[2]: to continue to live, be strong, or succeed after a difficult or dangerous time
example[3]: If he comes through the operation OK he should be back to normal within a month.
example[4]: It’s been a tough time, but I’m sure you’ll come through and be all the wiser for it.
